reference.title: Changing Bucket Parameters
reference.shortdesc: To modify bucket parameters, use the POST /pools/default/buckets/[bucket-name] HTTP method and URI with the bucket name being the REST API endpoint.

section.title: Description
section.p: You can modify existing bucket parameters by posting the updated parameters used to create the bucket to the bucketâ€™s URI. Do not omit a parameter in your request since this is equivalent to not setting it in many cases. We recommend you do a request to get current bucket settings, make modifications as needed and then make your POST request to the bucket URI.
section.note: The bucket name cannot be changed via the REST API.
When changing the active bucket configuration, specify the existing configuration parameters and the changed authentication parameters.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: curl -v -X POST -u [admin]:[password] -d name=[customer] -d flushEnabled=[0 | 1] -d replicaNumber=[value from 0 to 3] -d authType=[none | sasl] -d ramQuotaMB=[value] -d proxyPort=[port] http://[localhost]:8091/pools/default/buckets/[bucket-name]
